questions.question_text:
An app builder at Universal Containers wants to prevent users from creating new records on an Account related list by overriding standard buttons.

Which two aspects should the app builder consider before overriding standard buttons? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Yes, BD is correct

* If a button isn’t available for overrides, you can still hide it on the page layout.
* You can’t change buttons on lookup dialogs, reports, or tabs. However, you can change the buttons on list view and search result layouts under search layouts.
* You can’t relabel or relocate standard buttons on a record detail page.
* When overriding tabs or buttons with a Lightning component, you can select only Lightning components that implement the lightning:actionOverride interface.

At Universal Containers, the Account object has a Master-Detail relationship with an Invoice custom object. The app builder would like to change this to a lookup field, but is not able to do so.
What could be causing this?

discussion.content:
D.
When a parent object has a roll-up summary field, it indicates a dependency on the child records for calculations. Changing the relationship to a lookup would remove this dependency, potentially causing inconsistencies in the roll-up summary field values.
D is correct. If the parent object has rollup summary field of the child, it cannot be changed to lookup.
